profileText: A Representative from Maine; born in New Salem, Mass., July 3, 1805; attended the common schools; moved with his parents to Houlton, Maine, in 1822; engaged in extensive lumber operations and also in agricultural and mercantile pursuits; member of the State house of representatives in 1832, 1833, 1839-1842, 1848, 1849, and 1862; served in the State senate in 1843 and 1850-1853; elected as a Democrat to the Twenty-eighth Congress; took his seat May 10, 1844, and served until March 3, 1845; candidate of the Liberty Party for Governor in 1854; died in Houlton, Aroostook County, Maine, August 9, 1866; interment in Evergreen Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1829-1857, 0.25 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: Chiefly correspondence of Shepard Cary with Bion Bradbury, Anson Gancello Chandler, John Hodgdon, Gorham Parks, Timothy Pilsbury, Edward G. Rawson, Collin Whitaker, and others, about political affairs, but also some regarding lumbering and other matters. Includes cancelled checks and 12 letters to Collin Whitaker, Cary's business partner.

researchRecord.name: 1832-1895, 1 linear foot.
researchRecord.description: Mostly correspondence from business partner Collin Whitaker and others to Shepard Cary about lumbering in Aroostook County, Me., and political letters from Samuel Cony, John W. Dana, John Hodgdon, Leonard Jarvis, Lot M. Morrill, Barnabas Palmer, Benjamin Wiggin, and others, pertaining to political activities and events during the period 1845-1862. Also includes bills and receipts, deeds, leases, memoranda, etc.
